100.description: For any development project to be great, to be the best, it must balance good design and best programming practices. So how do we achieve this when designers and developers don't speak the same language? This session will dive into a matrix for successful communication between designers and developers.
100.title: Good Design vs. Best Practice

101.description:
Welcome to Bootstrap v4.0

What is Bootstrap? "Bootstrap is an open source toolkit for developing with HTML, CSS, and JS. Quickly prototype your ideas or build your entire app with our Sass variables and mixins, responsive grid system, extensive prebuilt components, and powerful plugins built on jQuery."

What this Code Lab will do:
This will be an introduction to the toolkit. We will be building a pretty basic webpage to understand the architecture

Things you will need:
- A laptop
- The ability to connect to the internet to download files

Optional:
- A web server that you can connect to and are familiar with
101.title: Intro to Bootstrap

102.description: Live coding demonstration showing how to build a simple web application using the Angular framework. Will include using Angular Material for UI components and Firebase or a public API to provide data source to demonstrate incorporating data. May include overview of hosting application (Github and Firebase) and implementing PWA components for the application.
102.title: Building Web Applications with Angular (4+)

103.description: Join us for conversation as we enjoy food and drink!
103.title: Lunch

104.description: Overview of the Redux pattern and how it can be used to manage state in applications. Examples will show how to use libraries such as rxjs and ngRx to implement the Redux methodology in modern javascript applications.
104.title: ⚡ Application State Management using the Redux Pattern

105.description: A talk about Janitor (https://janitor.technology/), an introduction to the fastest development system in the world. Complete with all the new features that have been added since last year's talk.
105.title: From `The Janitor` to `Janitor`

107.description: You come across something that just won't work as expected or keeps throwing errors at you. How do you turn this bad experience into something that is easy to understand for the developers to take action on and fix?
107.title: ⚡ Turning Bad News into a Good Bug Report

108.description: The City of Greater Sudbury website was recently redesigned. This is the inside story on how it happened!
108.title: Redesigning greatersudbury.ca

110.description: Get hands-on with Janitor to tackle a real bug!
110.title: Hands-on with Janitor

111.description: Not every solution has to be built from the ground up. Google Apps support the development of rapid solutions that are surprisingly flexible; this is the story of one such project.
111.title: ⚡ Running a strike on Google Sheets

speakers.title: Developer

speakers.bio: Deborah co-founded Fuel Multimedia in 2010. She came from a background in Print Journalism and Communications, where she worked in the fast-paced daily newspaper business for over five years.  During this time, she witnessed the evolution of storytelling platforms from print-based mediums towards an online eco-system. Seeing this change coming, she took the plunge to re-educate as a Web Designer and start a company that would focus on creating rich content and storytelling experiences told through the ever-changing language of the web. In her off hours, she loves photography and travel (insert cliché here).  She is also passionate about growing a business in Sudbury and assisting with the development of the technology sector in the Silicon Crater.
speakers.name: Deb Sauvé
speakers.shortBio: Deborah is a partner and Creative Director at Fuel Multimedia.  She has a background in Print Journalism, Communications, and Web Design, which lead her to co-found an agency that focuses on content-driven web experiences.
speakers.title: Creative Director

speakers.bio: I am a GDG Sudbury organizer, Chair of the Library & Archives at Laurentian University, and an adopter of and contributor to many open source and open knowledge projects.

speakers.shortBio: GDG Sudbury organizer and librarian of openness
speakers.title: Associate Librarian
